                                                                                                       epine proved ineffective and he opted not to try alter-
                                                                                                       native drugs. Serial assessments at 6-month intervals
                                                                                                       demonstrated no functional or radiographic changes.
                                                                                                           There are limited data regarding the natural history
                                                                                                       of syringomyelia. Several case series report that idiopathic
                                                                                                       syringomyelia with minimal neurologic symptoms only
                                                                                                       progresses in a minority of conservatively managed
                                                                                                       cases.7 Hence, the risks of nonintervention and regular
                                                                                                       monitoring appear to be limited in this patient group.
